question: Match the following:
answer: Monera–Noncellulosic (Polysaccharide + amino acid), Protista–Present in some, Fungi–Present with chitin, Plantae–Present (cellulose), Animalia–Absent

question: Match the following:
answer: Monera–Cellular, Protista–Cellular, Fungi–Multiceullar/loose tissue, Plantae–Tissue/organ, Animalia–Tissue/organ/organ system

question: Match the following:
answer: Monera–Autotrophic (chemosynthetic and photosynthetic) and Heterotrophic (saprophytic/parasitic), Protista–Autotrophic (Photosynthetic) and Heterotrophic, Fungi–Heterotrophic (Saprophytic/Parasitic), Plantae–Autotrophic (Photosynthetic), Animalia–Heterotrophic (Holozoic/Saprophytic etc.)

question: Match the following:
column_II: Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae and Animalia
Cell structure, body organisation, mode of nutrition, reproduction and phylogenetic relationships
Divides Kingdom Monera into two domains
matches: R.H. Whittaker (1969)–Proposed a Five Kingdom Classification
Five Kingdoms defined by Whittaker–Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae and Animalia
Main criteria for classification–Cell structure, body organisation, mode of nutrition, reproduction and phylogenetic relationships
Three-domain system–Divides Kingdom Monera into two domains
answer: R.H. Whittaker (1969)–Proposed a Five Kingdom Classification, Five Kingdoms defined by Whittaker–Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae and Animalia, Main criteria for classification–Cell structure, body organisation, mode of nutrition, reproduction and phylogenetic relationships, Three-domain system–Divides Kingdom Monera into two domains

question: Match the following:
column_I: Character that unified the whole kingdom ‘Plants’
column_II: Bacteria, blue green algae, fungi, mosses, ferns, gymnosperms and angiosperms
Fungi, mosses, ferns, gymnosperms and angiosperms
matches: Earlier classification systems included–Bacteria, blue green algae, fungi, mosses, ferns, gymnosperms and angiosperms
Character that unified the whole kingdom ‘Plants’–Cell wall in their cells
Prokaryotic organisms placed under ‘Plants’–Bacteria and blue green algae (cyanobacteria)
Eukaryotic organisms placed under ‘Plants’–Fungi, mosses, ferns, gymnosperms and angiosperms
answer: Earlier classification systems included–Bacteria, blue green algae, fungi, mosses, ferns, gymnosperms and angiosperms, Character that unified the whole kingdom ‘Plants’–Cell wall in their cells, Prokaryotic organisms placed under ‘Plants’–Bacteria and blue green algae (cyanobacteria), Eukaryotic organisms placed under ‘Plants’–Fungi, mosses, ferns, gymnosperms and angiosperms

question: Match the following:
column_I: Group not differentiated from autotrophic green plants in earlier classification
matches: Group not differentiated from autotrophic green plants in earlier classification–Heterotrophic group – fungi
answer: Unicellular organism placed under algae–Chlamydomonas, Multicellular organism placed under algae–Spirogyra, Group not differentiated from autotrophic green plants in earlier classification–Heterotrophic group – fungi, Wall composition of fungi–Chitin

question: Match the following:
column_I: Change in classification when wall composition considered
Kingdom to which fungi were placed when separated
column_II: Fungi placed in a separate kingdom
matches: Wall composition of green plants–Cellulosic cell wall
Change in classification when wall composition considered–Fungi placed in a separate kingdom
Kingdom to which fungi were placed when separated–Kingdom Fungi
answer: Wall composition of green plants–Cellulosic cell wall, Change in classification when wall composition considered–Fungi placed in a separate kingdom, Kingdom to which fungi were placed when separated–Kingdom Fungi, Blue green algae–Cyanobacteria
